byline.contributor: David E. Sanger reported from Washington, and Choe Sang-hun from Seoul, South Korea. Jonah Bromwich contributed reporting from New York.
byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER and CHOE SANG-HUN

abstract: North Korea says it has detonated its first hydrogen bomb, claim that, if proved true, would significantly increase threat from dangerous and isolated nation; detection devices measured 5.1 seismic event near North Korean coast, but it may be weeks or months before United States and allies can confirm nature of test.
lead_paragraph: The claim, if true, would drastically escalate the nuclear challenge from one of the world’s most isolated and dangerous states.

headline.main: North Korea Says It Has Detonated Its First Hydrogen Bomb
headline.print_headline: North Korea Says It Detonated Hydrogen Bomb for First Time

snippet: The claim, if true, would drastically escalate the nuclear challenge from one of the world’s most isolated and dangerous states.
